summary: Pokemon Card of the Day #1470: Serperior (Black & White #5)
title: Pokemon Card of the Day #1470: Serperior (Black & White #5)
body:
There were actually 2 Serperior cards in the Black & White set. This wasn’t the first time a first set of a generation had 2 of each starter, either; Neo Genesis and Ruby & Sapphire did the same. This was the less useful of the two, but it still tried to do something alongside other Grass-types in a deck that may have been cool in the right format.

130 HP was actually very average for a Stage 2 in the Black & White era. It did tend to be high enough to take a hit most of the time, especially since it had that -20 Water Resistance that protected it a bit against Kyurem later in the BW-On format. The x2 Fire Weakness did present some Reshiram issues, especially earlier in the HGSS-On format. Serperior didn’t need any Energy to retreat, which was really nice to have if you wanted to save your Serperior. It wasn’t as important as you’d think at a time with Pokemon Catcher available, but it was at least something.

Vine Whip just did 40 damage for 2 Colorless Energy. This wasn’t even close to enough.

Leaf Storm’s 60 damage for 2 Grass Energy wasn’t all that amazing either, but it did heal 20 damage from each of your Grass-type Pokemon. If you could move damage counters around, you might be able to pull off a tanky deck, though you’d probably need Reuniclus to pull it off. Reuniclus wasn’t even a Grass-type and you were stuck with a bunch of Stage 2 Pokemon with likely other Grass-types and it was really clunky to use.

Serperior’s Leaf Storm might have been enough in a slow format. The idea of healing a bit of damage from each Pokemon of a type while attacking was a good one. Too bad about all those Pokemon that could deal absurd amounts of damage. You had Reshiram, Zekrom, Mewtwo EX, Darkrai EX, Thundurus EX, Kyurem, Landorus EX, Black Kyurem EX… There were too many fast, powerful options for a slow Stage 2 deck to keep up, and even other Stage 2 decks tended to get going a lot more quickly than Serperior could. Even early HGSS-On Stage 1 Pokemon like Yanmega just worked too quickly. This Serperior brought a fun idea that was a bit too late to the game to have a chance.

reblog.comment:

blog.name: friendsafariserver
blog.title: Friend Safari!
blog.description:
Friend Safari is a SFW, OC-friendly, paragraph-style roleplay server for main series Pokémon games. From Kanto to Alola, the whole Pokémon world is your Cloyster! Members of this server are allowed a total of four played characters, with at least one required to be canonical.

The server is run by a team of five mods who you can learn more about via the mods page. We cultivate an easygoing and open atmosphere, with member comfort and happiness being our top priority.

All of the links are in the drop down menu under Rowlet, labeled Pokémon! Hovering over each Pokémon will tell you what page they link to!

summary: Welcome to the Friend Safari! Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region,...
body:
Welcome to the Friend Safari!

Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region, multiple modes for character interactions, and plenty of in-character events, ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about our server, head over to our rules!

Reblog this ad, stop by our blog and check us out!

Rules | Joining | Characters | Timeline
